results.title: Malcolm
results.brief_description: Malcolm, a simple genius played by Colin Friels, loses his job at a Melbourne tram depot after building his own one-man tram and taking to the streets. With funds dwindling, Malcolm is forced to take in a lodger, a small time criminal who moves in with girlfriend, Judith. Frank soon realises that Malcolm’s mechanical wizardry can help his career - the result - a series of oddball but unsuccessful robberies that culminates in the heist of the decade that stretches Malcolm’s devices to the full. “Malcolm” was critically acclaimed worldwide and received eight AFI Awards including best director and best film.

results.title: Major league (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, Chris Chesser, Irby Smith and David S. Ward
results.brief_description: The recently widowed, and new owner of the Cleveland Indians has a plan: field the worst team ever, watch the attendance fall, then move the franchise to glorious sun-drenched Miami. So she signs a punk-pitcher (Charlie Sheen), a gimpy-kneed womanising catcher (Tom Berenger), a third-rate third baseman (Corbin Bernsen), the outfielder Willie May Hates (Wesley Snipes) and a ‘wayout’ field of other crazy misfits. The perfect plan? maybe not, but it is the perfect ingredients for this riotous and inspiring comedy.

results.title: Magnum force
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Daley and Ted Post
results.brief_description: The second “Dirty Harry” movie, “Magnum Force” concerns itself with a vigilante group that has targeted notorious criminals whose power and influence have made them immune from prosecution. When a prominent gang boss is set free by the air-headed liberal courts, he is soon exterminated by an avenging motorcycle cop. While Detective Harry Callahan is no great friend of civil liberties, he is dead set against wholesale murder as a solution to legal loopholes. Discovering that all the killings have been committed by a .357 Magnum, Callahan suspects his on-the-edge ex-partner is responsible. But the conspiracy is less transparent than that, as Harry learns, almost at the cost of his own life. Co-scripted by John Milius and Michael Cimino. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Hal Holbrook, Mitchell Ryan, Felton Perry and David Soul.

results.title: Magical mystery tour
results.creator_credit: Beatles, George Harrison, Bernard Knowles, John Lennon, Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr
results.brief_description: Join The Beatles on an hallucinatory mystery tour to the tunes of “Baby your a rich man”, “Penny lane”, “Flying”, “The Fool on the hill”, “All you need is love”, “Strawberry fields forever”, “Blue jay way”, “Hello goodbye”, “I am the walrus”, “Your mother should know”, and “All my loving”.

results.title: Made for each other
results.creator_credit: ABC International, Selznick International, David O. Selznick and John Cromwell
results.brief_description: James Stewart and Carole Lombard star in this romantic drama which ends happily ever after. John and Jane Mason begin their newly wedded life with a series of problems. John’s mother is angry because Jane does not meet her expectations, and John’s boss places enormous pressures on them. They are forced to live in a tiny apartment with Mrs. Mason and struggle to make ends meet. After their baby arrives, they separate as the strain becomes too much for their marriage. However, the baby’s serious illness draws them together again, heals the breach between them and turns John’s mother and boss into allies.

results.title: Mad Max: beyond thunderdome
results.creator_credit: Kennedy Miller Productions, Byron Kennedy, George Miller and George Ogilvie
results.brief_description: Mad Max continues as the hero who stands alone against barbarians of a post-nuclear age. The action is set in Bartertown, where Max arrives in search of some stolen property and has to fight a duel in the Thunderdome arena. Mel Gibson is joined by Tina Turner in the third Mad Max film. Cast also includes Helen Buday, Frank Thring, Bruce Spence, Robert Grubb, Angry Anderson.

results.title: Mad Max (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mad Max Films, Kennedy Miller Productions, Byron Kennedy and George Miller
results.brief_description: Mad Max marked the debut of Australian director George Miller and his first collaboration with Mel Gibson. Part science fiction, part road movie, “Mad Max” is a futuristic vision of a post-apocalyptic Australia where ordered society is fast disintegrating into violent chaos. In this anarchic setting, rogue gangs menacingly roam the land in search of petrol (a vital and increasingly scarce resource), spoils of looting and bloodthirsty fun. Mel Gibson stars as Max Rockatansky, a good cop made mad by the death of his wife and child and the hands of a gang of feral bikies. The film follows Max as he embarks on a personal vendetta to avenge the death of his family, armed with anger, a gun and his car - “the last of the V-8 interceptors”. “Mad Max” has a much-imitated visual and thematic style - gang members are clad in filthy rags with maimed bodies; the landscape is bleak and featureless; camps are transitory pit-stops between war zones; and machines rule their owners. “Mad Max”, with its ordinary hero and car culture narrative, fits neatly into the zeitgeist of 1970s filmmaking. A nihilistic road movie, fuelled by male angst, “Mad Max” is a thrilling, truly original film that remains a highlight of Australian film history.

results.title: Mad Dog and Glory
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Barbara de Fina, Martin Scorsese and John McNaughton
results.brief_description: Robert De Niro and Uma Thurman star as title characters Mad Dog and Glory in this unassuming romantic comedy. A divorced evidence gathering policeman and aspiring photographer, Wayne “Mad Dog” Dobie earns his nickname in reference to his mild mannered nature. One night while on duty Mad Dog inadvertently saves the life of local gangster and part time comedian Frank Milo (a dour Bill Murray, cast against type). Under guidance from his therapist and eager to bring happiness to the life of someone who empathises with his desire to be someone else, Milo befriends Mad Dog and loans Glory (Thurman) to him for a week. Before the week is over Mad Dog and Glory have fallen in love and the two are faced with settling Glory’s brother’s gambling debt to Milo in exchange for their relationship. Cast also includes David Caruso and Mike Star as convincingly menancing sidekick heavyweights and Kathy Baker as Mad Dog’s neighbour.
